By no means is this a groundbreaking or genre defining game. review_text: For an April Fool's joke, they didn't have to make it as good as it is, like what the **** this is really good and the best part is that I understood the references. For Christs sake THEY MENTIONED THE EXISTENCE OF SONIC UNLEASHED, AKA ONE OF THE BEST 3D SONIC GAMES EVER MADE.

game_title: The Murder of Sonic the Hedgehog
review_text: The Best and most recent example of an April Fools joke for video games is Sonic’s Murder, an interactive and entertaining graphic novel style game that is based around of “What If Sonic is murdered?”.

There's a LOT in this game - wargame, politics, resource/production, diplomacy, and more. A very well done UI and design given the amount of things that can be adjusted and managed. A system of advisors to help and keep micromanagement under control. Great battles!
Looks very nice so far. A huge amount of units, territory, technology, combined with terrain actions leads to a great game. It does, however, look a bit complicated, with a steep learning curve.

The most fun I've had with a strategy game since Alpha Centauri. Deep gameplay, innovation, and a "do anything" design are just a few reasons why I like this so much. It's not perfect, (what strategy title is straight out of the box?) but it definately deserves a nine for somehow managing to be both innovative and fun at the same time.
Good, sophisticated, flexible game. Fun to play. AI is very weak. A few minor bugs which will probably be fixed in a patch.

game_title: American Civil War: Take Command - Second Manassas
review_text: Best Civil War game .. plain and simple. Its funny to read some of the reviews and obvious they have no idea what they are talking about. If you like historical accuracy over flashy graphics this is for you. The 3d engine does do a great job making you feel immersed into the environment.. more so considering the maps are 100% accurate.
It has bugs but is enjoyable game.
Great game, with some issues to be addressed.
While unpolished at release, a true gem, and spectacular fun and interesting. With Battlefront's previous track record the CMx engine will once again define wargaming.

Challenging! And great potential. Knowing BFC, patches (based on players' feedbacks, not whines...) will not only correct but also improve the game. I really like to play it...and get kicked alot :) . Lots to learn.
The thrill has gone... A very paltry offering compared to the original CM series. I guess they wanted to hook in some of the zap and zoom crowd.

I would have given this game a 3 when it was released, however, after eight patches, this game has improved immensely. There are still issues, especially with infantry combat in dense, urban terrain, but overall the game is very playable in its present state. If you were disappointed with this game 6 months ago, I recommend giving it another try now.
I liked it when it first came with the bugs and each time they patch it, it gets better.
Buggy, crashing, features missing.
Bad start but worked better every patch. I think the community has responded negatively because they were expecting the be all end all.
Incomplete, akward UI and missing many of the essential features from Cmx1. Hopefully will get better with future patches.

Incredible bug ridden piece of crap. LOS/LOF is totally fucked up. Pathfinding is a joke. Multiplayer is still absent/not-functioning even after the 1.04 patch. Stay away from this kind of crap! Battlefront obviously tried to rip off their loyal customer base, which build up over the past with the CMx1 titles, to make a quick buck. You better burn your money instead of wasting it with CMSF.
Broken, unfinished, unplayable multiplayer.
What a disappointment. I waited four years for this? Shame on Battlefront.
Terrible dissappointment. Some things can be fixed (but won't be - like trenches turning into indistinct blobs from a few hundred yards out) and some can't (like no proper WEGO).

Buggy, clunky interface, and poor graphics (particulalry when viewing from high levels). Is related to its namesake line of games in name only. It seems Battelfront has decided to remove some of the best features of its earlier games, including random map building and allowing users and scenario designers to tailor their forces. Most disappointing release from an otherwise great company.

Dysfunctional AI, sub-par gfx, tons of hardware problems with AMD, Intel, ATI + Nvidia, dysfunctional LOS+LOF, obviously no quality control before release, huge dissapointment from this release which is nothing more than an open beta.
I have never in my life been so dissapointed. This , and the AWFUL "theatre of war" finally made me abandon Big Time Software (Battlefront.com)... a horrible, horrible game.
Awful, awful, awful. This is a shameful offering from a once great development team. Still riddled with bugs after patch 1.02 and 1.03 and the infantry combat is laughable.

Almost a year in and its still plagued by slow downs that make any extended campaign turn into a crawl. UI is worse than its predecessor in some ways and it generally feels like its waiting on an expansion to bring the full features you would expect. If you're the patient sort of lad then wait a fair while for an expansion and pick it up cheap.

I tried the demo and it wasn't to my taste. I was hoping for something with a bit more action, and all I got was lots of adjusting spreadsheets. But some people will like this style of "intense strategy", so try the demo you've got nothing to lose.

Not much seems to happen, so I was a bit disappointed. Maybe I'm playing it wrong. I don't think Paradox have made a bad bit of software, I generally like them in principle, but I wouldn't really call it a game. I prefer real-time battles, or other Paradox games like Mount & Blade.

Spent YEARS playing EU2, spent MONTHS playing Vicci (ONE), spent WEEKS playing Crusader Kings, spent minutes playing this pile of junk. Please Paradox. DO NOT RELEASE THE SAME GAME OVER AND OVER AGAIN. â
Don't bother with this game, and by all means ignore the 10s that you see here on metacritic. It's only the fanboys/paradox people trying to push the score up. At least they didnt get my money...â

Hey Look! Shogun 2: Total War! I think I will just go play that instead.... I tried the demo and it wasn't to my taste. I was hoping for something with a bit more action, and all I got was lots of adjusting spreadsheets. But some people will like this style of "intense strategy", so try the demo you've got nothing to lose.
Another nice game from Paradox. Beautiful, polished, and fun. An enjoyable exercise, pick up a copy of Sun Tsu's "Art of War" and put his principles into action.

You need to spend a fair amount of time to learn the game. The lack of a tutorial is sad, but the manual is good. If you manage to "survive" the first couple of hours figuring things out, you're in for a treat with great strategic depth. It's one of those Paradox gems which will get even better with time thanks to its player community and lots of patches.

While the game does have a rather steep learning curve, once you figure it out you will be hooked. The atmosphere and music really set the right tone for this game, you may even begin to feel like a samurai after a while. Although there are still a few bugs, and this game may not be for everyone, but if you ever wanted to be a lord feudal Japan this is about as close as you can get.

It's quite an interesting game I think. It's not in the same mold as most Paradox games as it forces you to be very aggressive and conquest minded (understandable as you need to unite Japan) but it was fairly polished and bug free upon release. Beautiful graphics and a very well done atmosphere. I'd like to see an expansion with the Imjin wars versus Korea/Ming in the future.
A fairly shameful display if you ask me. I spent thirty minutes flying around the map wondering what was going on. I should've learned from the shoddy demo that it wasn't worth my money. Refund?

One of the best out-of-the-box Paradox releases. It's certainly not a game for everyone -- but no paradox game is -- but if you have a little patience and a passion for strategy games, this character-based attempt at depicting Feudal Japan in all it's glory is an excellent choice.
this game rocks! It's exactly like it happened, I just finished the civil war in school. BEST GAME EVER!!!!!

A very dedicated Dev team, and possibly the best Paradoxian release, none of the problems that the Hearts of Iron release suffered, the willingness to listen to the community is amazing

CMBN has evolved into a solid title in the 2nd gen of the series. Sure it could really (desperately?)use a more robust graphics engine but the core gameplay is there. I play all kinds of games but Combat Mission will always have a special place in my gaming hobby world.

Never before have i played a WW2 game with so much attention to detail or that was so intense, and unforgiving. The game has a steep learning curve, but once you learn it you will be rewarded. I have CMbn and both its modules (expansions) and there is no other ww2 game like them in the world.

It's hard to compare this to games that are out at this time, but Worms continues its nostalgic familiarity and quirky gameplay. If you have played any of the previous titles than this is a must own. The multiplayer is great but I want to have more than 4 Worms in one match.

A brilliant game, needs some time to understand everything going on "under the hood" of the game, but it is the most realistic squad level strategy bar none!! As well as looking great there is a real attention to detail for authenticity.

There is simply no better tactical war simulation game available, and I've played most all of them. I do not understand anybody who tries to discredit this game for a bunch of nit-picking factors, those are the only negatives I have seen, both personally and from others discussions. If you can find a better tactical wargame, please do tell me what it is and I'll play that. Good luck.

One of the best open world games I've played since gaming started for me which was the late 70s. Remarkable achievement. I haven't had this much fun playing a single player video game since "Jedi Fallen Order" years ago. I am absolutely losing myself in this game and there's so much to do. It feels amazing, it's accessible, it's fun, it's well-written. I love it. I can't recommend it enough.

Its basically everything HP fan might want from a game and then some more. Not without flaws, but really they don't matter much. Les graphismes sont fantastiques. Le château a l'air vraiment génial et on peut explorer toutes sortes de choses. Cela inclut différents villages, la forêt interdite et bien plus encore.
I don't have time to write a review now, just writing this as a reminder. I will edit this text when I have time.

Wirklich tolles Spiel. Man kann auf verschiedenen Tierwesen und natürlich auf einem Besen durch die große und richtig detailreiche Welt fliegen, aber auch zu Fuß alles erkunden. Das Schloss und die Natur sind einfach atemberaubend schön. Die Geschichte hat mir auch gefallen. Hier und da hätte man gern etwas mehr Tiefe in die Charaktere stecken können, aber ich bin trotzdem sehr zufrieden.
It is very poorly optimized many pulls many failures on top having a good PC the game at first is cool but then you get tired and you want to finish it

So far, I really like the game. I've spent a lot of time in the room of requirement, setting everything up just the way I like it. I think it's great that there's player housing in the game. The world overall just looks fantastic.

Hogwarts Legacy really appeals to me. I've been playing it for several days now and there are still plenty of things to discover. The graphics are the most impressive aspect, of course. They are simply breathtaking and the castle is just gigantic. But the environment looks amazing as well.
It's "an ok game", but just that, all the NPCs are boring too.

The game is really enjoyable. The graphics are breathtaking and the world looks simply magical and beautiful. However, I wish there were more emotes for the player character. Also, I don't understand why we can only keep a handful of animals in the room of requirement. Each room has more than enough space. Apart from that, the game is top-notch.
Pretty cool game with amazing graphics, good characters and fun activities.

Overall it was a very enjoyable experience. It was a rather bland game for me. I wish the battles were a little more diverse. You get more pleasure after the middle of the game, but you continue to get the same pleasure until the end of the game.
Hogwarts Legacy is pure magic!
Amazing game.
Good atmosphere, amazing Hogwarts and villages, fight system is pretty nice. But the plot is boring, characters are also boring
Let me just say that the graphics of this game are chef's kiss amazing.

Works well as a Harry Potter walking sim, if you're a fan of the series. Sub-standard Ubisoft style gameplay, mostly stale characters and dead fish of a protagonist make this a slog, though. Didn't finish.

The world is breathtaking and combat system really good. Im sad now that i dont know HP universum a little bit more. But after this experience i might read some books and then return to the game again.

Open world RPG set in the magical world, with its own interpretation while respecting the original work. Punctual fps drop in cinematics and certain areas. Great game. I am not a Harry Potter Fan but I am actually considering to buy all the books now. Wow.

The classic Worms returns with a good polished style game. You can play on random level and you can generate infinite diferent levels to play alone. As a fan of the original I was thrilled to play Worms Reloaded! Allthough after a few moments I discovered that it is no longer possible to team up with a human player against AI players. What the Hell? This was one of the most awesome features of Worms since Worms 2! I agree that this version has made backward progress. It is very sad to see, I would not recommend this game to my friends.

The game is alright. But the single player campaign is horrible. Way WAY WAY to tuff. I am a big time gamer and I find the campaign very annoying. There are several mission that have to be done perfectly or you lose the match (lv 24 & 30 for example). If you fail you have to start over from the very beginning. Extremely annoying.

The advertising is misleading. It states that all weapons and content from every wormgame is included, which obviously isn't. The first 6 weeks the game was unplayable because of multiplayer bugs. It still doesn't run on many win7 64b computers for no obvious reason. The game is exacly the same as 10 years ago, with one layer of extra polish on it.

review_text: Excellent sound design. Beautiful graphics. Good atmosphere. Fully translated voice acting - thank you very much for this! I wish good luck to this studio, I hope they will continue to delight us with chic interesting games.

This is essentially what happens when somebody who grew up playing JRPGs in the 90s ends up making his dream game. This is filled to the brim with references to SNES and PS1 classics but at the same time eschews the time-consuming and tech-limited aspects of the era. If you like Chrono Trigger, Xenogears, Final Fantasy and Breath of Fire, you'll be supremely entertained with this little gem.
Great soundtrack and combat system, awesome history, beautiful pixelart, nice exploration, and endearing characters! best JRPG game that i've played in years
Definitely the best RPG I played in 2022! The end result is a gameplay and pixelart lesson.
Thank you all for this great adventure!!! Crying at the ending))) (boy 30 years old)

The best turned based RPG I have played since persona5. It’s a true throwback that doesn’t hold your hand. Lots of exploration and a fun battle system. Anyone giving this game a score lower than an 8 is trolling.
It's a great game. It is a game with a pretty good fighting method, map design, and above all, high completeness. I think this game could be nominated for the 2023 TGA Indie Game of the Year.

A great modern take on a traditional style of jrpg. The pixel art is good, the music is fantastic, the gameplay is addicting, the story is decent, the challenge is moderate, and it has a reasonable length especially for its price. Chained Echoes is definitely a traditional jrpg enthusiast's dream.

Simply superb. Made by one man who obviously knows his way around an rpg. Since starting it, I simply cannot put it down, and even find myself thinking about the game during the times I am not playing it!
One of the best jrpg game in years. Chained Echoes is a gem and should be played by anyone who love this genre.

I'm not the biggest fan of JRPG's but this is one of the best rpg's I've played in the last few years. It really is amazing. Great cast of characters, awesome combat system that is reminiscent of classic jrpg's but innovative on it's own and a really good story. Highly recommended.

Good retro style game with a lot of nice gameplay novelties. The story is really good, even the side quests are something fun. The fighting is good but some bosses are difficult at the end. And I pretty much hate grinding. I give the game 85%. Finally a non generic JRPG that doesn't feel like a RPG maker clones.
I'm so happy. Chained Echoes is fantastic and super fun. Great story and characters, Great mechanics. It's a JRPG from the 90s but made today with plenty of quality of life changes. SO GOOD.
Great JRPG. Amazing story, made me remember the good old days. If you liked Chrono Trigger, you are going to love this.
Very well-made RPG!
This is the best old-school style jrpg I've ever played. The story, characters, and combat are all in point.
My 2022 GOTY. Hands down. A nod to a better age of gaming where combat and story actually mattered. Beautiful work.

Rarely I type a review down to Metacritic but for Chained Echoes it is my pleasure to help other people and convice them to try Chained Echoes. It is really a true JRPG which no one should skip. Play this modern JRPG in 2023.

This game is the culmination of the things RPGs done right in the past decades. It reminds me of a lot of things: Chrono Trigger, Xenoblade, Xenogears, Final Fantasy, and heck, even a little bit of FMA. It draws out inspiration from past titles but keeps its own flavor. This is simply an RPG done right, and it's all that need be said.
This game is a masterpiece for beginning to the end. Soundtrack, progression system, puzzles, fights, skills. The Story is one of the best I've ever seen. The producer is a Chrono Trigger fan. Enjoy!

Thanks Sony for giving us patch v1.3 for non-avx2 Cpus, now I am able to play Uncharted on Pc with my i7 3770k + Gtx 1080Ti. Balancing a metroidvania and souls like is easy for Ghost Song. I did not feel like i was playing a game, but felt as though I was unraveling a story that is written with such care and finesse. The memorable moments, waking up, defeating an enemy, or just walking through a well built atmospheric setting led me to fall in love with this brilliant piece of art.

This game really scratched my Metroid itch. It was a perfect blend between Metroid and Hollow Knight. If I had one gripe is that it doesn't have challenging platforming or puzzles and I found the environments a little lacking. I love the creativeness of the weapons as well as the boss fights.

At a time when I thought games were incapable of surprising me, Scorn proved me otherwise. This game has a superb art direction and a core gameplay reminiscent of classic "Survival horror". Despite that, it is important to note that its abstract narrative, its lack of interest in explaining its own mechanics and its emphasis on puzzles, make it a game far from the mainstream.

It's an amazing game with stunning visuals and interesting puzzles. Combat is a bit sloppy, but good overall. The story brings a strong philosophical message and leaves space to think of your own interpretation of it. Soundtrack is filled with great ambient tracks. Most importantly, the game feels very unique which is not so comon nowadays.

Magnificent atmosphere, art, sound. Absolutely 100% must have for H.R. Higer fans. But other gamers I think will be disappointed because 70% of gameplay is walking, 20% puzzles and 10% is shooting. If tou will not love art style of this game it just will be a very boring walk for you.

A truly incredible and faithful recreation of the old classic SSI Panzer General series. Needs a thorough reimagining on all fronts; US side/Soviets, perhaps a futuristic or cold war version. review_text: Basic story, childish humor, most of the music is so generic that it doesn't inspire me to keep the rhythm. The only positive thing about the game is several story cutscenes that are well produced. I love good rhythm games, this is not one of them.

game_title: Airborne Assault: Conquest of the Aegean
review_text: This game is one that truly deserves critical acclaim by all those who are interested in the WW2 Genre. If you like the Combat Mission series, have the patience to enjoy tactics over spunky graphics, then you will surely enjoy this game.

game_title: Airborne Assault: Conquest of the Aegean
review_text: This game is the only I've seen with an engine that can give you a realistic, top-down, real time simulation of battalion and regimental maneuvers. What the close combat series did for squad and platoon tactics this does for strategy. If you're more interested in flash and bang, fine, go play call of duty. But I find this series to be the most immersive and realistic wargame available.

game_title: Decisive Battles of WWII Vol 2: Korsun Pocket
Decisive Battles of WWII Vol 2: Korsun Pocket
Decisive Battles of WWII Vol 2: Korsun Pocket
review_text: If you're an old board-gamer looking for the computerized answer to the classic hex based games, this is it. The interface does all the tracking for you and let's you spend time on designing a strategy. I got it second hand from one of my neighbors kids who was looking for a shoot em up 3-D game. He may have been disappointed, not me!

game_title: Decisive Battles of WWII Vol 2: Korsun Pocket

game_title: Decisive Battles of WWII Vol 2: Korsun Pocket
review_text: If you have Attention Deficit Disorder don't buy this game. You'll hate it. But if you enjoy strategy and thinking problems through you'll LOVE this game. It's a fantastic game.

review_text: Some of us still like to use our brain and this game will allow and make you do it. This is not for the mad clicking helter skelter player but a true armchair general.

Still the gold standard for WEGO, squad-based, company level "strategy" games set in the Second World War. Panzer Command is coming along nicely, but lacks a decent map editor. It's unfortunate BFC put this one in the rearview mirror with a couple of minor bugs still on the workbench, but it shouldn't deter players from still enjoying this one, even years after release.

game_title: The Legend of Heroes: Trails to Azure

review_text: I've been holding off playing this until it came out of early access and I'm so glad I did. It's almost exactly what I've been wanting ever since I played Freelancer and Starlancer back in the day.
I was aloways looking for a fun space flight game, which can beat Freelancer ... I found it.
Backed when early access started, but waited for release. Glad it totally is to my liking!

Very good, lengthy space ARPG with top-notch graphics, rewarding upgrade spiral, hit-or-miss soundscape and forgettable story. The core gameplay, that is space combat is very enjoyable, but at the fringes the game shows it's only a double-A title. It may ripen further over time.

review_text: Really good game. Great art, amazing music, simple and nice story, lots of lore stuff for long time fans, and overall, just such a good vibe to play!

Ghost Song is a captivating Metroidvania with beautiful art and story writing. There's so much depth to the characters, each with their own unique voice acting. There's a human quality to the writing, something I've never experienced before in a game of this genre.

game_title: The Murder of Sonic the Hedgehog
review_text: Before this game released, I genuinely thought it was an April Fool's joke, that wasn't going to release. Then it released and i had fun playing it. Art style is great, story nice. Sonic got better recently (Sonic Prime, Sonic Frontiers)

Balancing a metroidvania and souls like is easy for Ghost Song. I did not feel like i was playing a game, but felt as though I was unraveling a story that is written with such care and finesse. The memorable moments, waking up, defeating an enemy, or just walking through a well built atmospheric setting led me to fall in love with this brilliant piece of art.
Ghost Song is a nice Game for Game Pass, which it is included. The Game is about 12-14 hours and there is nothing New, but it has a great atmosphere.

This game really scratched my Metroid itch. It was a perfect blend between Metroid and Hollow Knight. If I had one gripe is that it doesn't have challenging platforming or puzzles and I found the environments a little lacking. I love the creativeness of the weapons as well as the boss fights.

Simply amazing metroidvania. Great visual art design and music. Terrific storyline and characters. Cannot understand the criticism for this game, as I am really enjoying it and it ticks all the right boxes for a metroidvania. Well done to the Devs and keep up the good work. Looking forward to your next game, thank you!

The most Metroid game out there. Took out the dumb counter system of modern Metroid, to allow for a melee system. Way better. Not sure why the low review I play sooo many Metroidvanias and, this one, is a standout.
很像银河战士的作品，地图也非常大，怪物种类虽然少了一些，但也可以了。难度有些大，需要肝，否则有点硬核，游戏关卡不是很好打。总体上讲不错，画风上来说我其实不是很喜欢，不过也不是不可以接受，看人吧。设计上肯定还是有不足的，但也算不错的游戏了。

Overall happy with purchase. Love exploring the world, very atmospheric. With some cool boss fights that were fun and challenging. Gameplay was diverse, similar to charm system in hollow knight. Only downside was fast travel disabled and had to backtrack when MINOR SPOILER bringing back ship parts. Luckily doesn’t take too long to do it. I say give it a go if you a fan of metroidvanias.

Balancing a metroidvania and souls like is easy for Ghost Song. I did not feel like i was playing a game, but felt as though I was unraveling a story that is written with such care and finesse. The memorable moments, waking up, defeating an enemy, or just walking through a well built atmospheric setting led me to fall in love with this brilliant piece of art.

This game really scratched my Metroid itch. It was a perfect blend between Metroid and Hollow Knight. If I had one gripe is that it doesn't have challenging platforming or puzzles and I found the environments a little lacking. I love the creativeness of the weapons as well as the boss fights.

Ghost Song is a captivating Metroidvania with beautiful art and story writing. There's so much depth to the characters, each with their own unique voice acting. There's a human quality to the writing, something I've never experienced before in a game of this genre.
Enjoyed the game most especially the sensitive writing. This type of game doesnt usually have this type of writing
